file_content.text: I'll tell the boys' families they died bravely in the line of duty.
If the brass doesn't send more men soon, these won't be the last ones to snap.
State your business!
This is a Republic military outpost, sovereign territory of the Galactic Republic.
We will defend ourselves with deadly force if necessary.
Don't you recognize a Jedi when you see one?
Hold your fire.
Apologies, Master Jedi. Forgive my paranoia.
When fear blinds you to your friends, everyone becomes an enemy.
I'm an ally.
Who are--Master Jedi! My apologies. I wasn't expecting to see one of your order.
First lieutenant, Havoc Squad. Most recently of Ord Mantell.
I'm Republic.
Lieutenant! Welcome to our outpost.
You're not going to make many friends with an attitude like that.
Can't we start with "hello"?
Sorry. Wasn't sure if you were Republic.
Do you have some reason to fear an invasion?
Is there a problem here?
Don't be stupid.
Well, that's hardly the tone I'd expect from an Imperial spy, so I'll assume you're Republic.
There's no unauthorized travel this far into the wilds; best policy's usually blast first, chat later.
Don't suppose you were sent by Commander Gardit with news about our supplies?
There's a convoy on the way from the last outpost.
Your supplies are coming.
Your supplies are on the way, but no thanks to him.
Gardit's a crook.
Sounds like there's a story there, but I won't waste your time asking for it. Let me just say "thanks."
I cleared the route for them.
That's a relief. Our own convoy never reported back--wouldn't be the first time we lost one to the nexu.
I was about to send another, but that means leaving the whole outpost understaffed and undefended. And the rakghouls have been real active this month.
Don't suppose you saw any sign of our boys? If they're still alive, they better have a good excuse for leaving us hanging.
I found your convoy on my way here.
Actually, I have news.
Did the nexu get them? Wouldn't be the first time.
They're alive, though? They'd better have a good excuse if they don't expect to get the lockup.
Your men left because they could bear no more.
I saved them from your abuse.
They deserted? Craven dogs!
No offense, Master Jedi, but this is the army. You sign up because you love the Republic more than your own life.
No one can fight constantly with no rest for the mind. Change your ways or more of your troops will flee.
They're beyond your grasp now.
No offense, Master Jedi, but you had no right--those men are soldiers who gave their lives to the Republic. They can't just take them back.
When your own commander treats you like a prisoner of war, sometimes deserting is the only option.
I helped them off-planet.
We're soldiers! You know what that means--we swore an oath that the Republic's worth more than our own lives.
Soldiers are still people, Commander. Treat them badly enough, and they'll leave.
Your men are safe now.
You've never been in uniform, and you're telling me how to run things? Soldiers have to care about something more than themselves!
If that means dying in the muck with a rakghoul's teeth around your throat, well... any soldier who'd give less isn't worthy of the name.
You see those boys again, you tell them there's a cold cell waiting for them.
I found their bodies along the route.
Your men are dead.
No surprise. Ah, well, they'll be missed. I'll send their uniforms home to their kin.
Sorry. No sign of them.
I'll have to assume the worst. Usually not much left to find if the nexu were at them.
Anyway, thanks for the help and the news. This sure won't help morale.
Everyone else will just have to work a bit harder now....
They're deserters. I found them hiding in the wreckage.
Your men went AWOL.
Those lazy, selfish sons of Hutts! We have men starving here!
I'll drag the useless lot of them back for trial!
They will not go unpunished.
They were on their way offworld. You need to punish them.
I stopped their treason.
Thank you, Master Jedi. I see that your order understands the need for discipline.
Thank you, Lieutenant. You know what happens to discipline when a few selfish individuals disrupt the chain of command.
Thank you. It's nice to find a civilian with so clear an understanding of military discipline.
To defeat the Sith, we must maintain constant vigilance.
They're on their way back.
That... sounds like there's more to the story than you're telling me. I'll get it out of them when they get back to base.
Whatever their excuse, I can't imagine it will be good....
Republic Outpost Four. No unauthorized visitors.
